That sounds like a great experience! I'd be happy to help you learn more about the Modern Art Museum's contemporary collection.

The Modern Art Museum of Fort Worth has an impressive collection of contemporary art, with a focus on works created from the 1970s to the present. The museum's contemporary collection includes a diverse range of media, such as painting, sculpture, photography, video, and installation art.

Some of the notable contemporary artists represented in the museum's collection include:

1. Gerhard Richter: A German artist known for his abstract and photorealistic paintings.
2. Ellsworth Kelly: An American painter, sculptor, and printmaker who explored color and form in his work.
3. Cy Twombly: An American artist who combined painting and drawing to create abstract and expressive works.
4. Anselm Kiefer: A German artist who explores themes of history, politics, and culture through large-scale installations and paintings.
5. Yayoi Kusama: A Japanese artist known for her vibrant, immersive installations and sculptures that explore themes of infinity and self-obliteration.

The museum also regularly rotates its contemporary exhibitions, so be sure to check their website or visit their information desk to see what's on display during your visit.

It's great to hear that you attended a guided tour recently! The Modern Art Museum offers guided tours that provide in-depth information about specific sections of their collection. These tours can be a great way to gain a deeper understanding of the art and artists on display.

If you have any specific questions about the contemporary collection or would like more information about upcoming exhibitions, feel free to ask!
